A world free of mental illness stigma - People would no longer be judged or discriminated against for their mental health, leading to increased social inclusion and acceptance. Confidence score: 0.8

Improved productivity and creativity - With the burden of mental illness lifted, individuals would be able to focus on their work and hobbies without distraction, leading to increased productivity and creativity. Confidence score: 0.9
Reduced crime and violence - Mental illness has been linked to increased rates of criminal behavior, so a cure could lead to a decrease in crime and violence. Confidence score: 0.9

Changes in social dynamics - The cure could lead to shifts in social dynamics, as people become more empathetic and understanding of others' mental health, leading to stronger, more supportive relationships. Confidence score: 0.8

New ethical considerations - With the cure, there would be new ethical considerations, such as ensuring that the cure is accessible to all and addressing concerns around privacy and personal autonomy. Confidence score: 0.7
